title: Multi-Agent Active Inference
description: Understanding how Active Inference extends to multi-agent systems and social interaction.
learning_objectives: Understand Active Inference in multi-agent contexts
Model other agents' beliefs and intentions
Apply Active Inference to social coordination

content.overview: Multi-agent Active Inference extends the framework to systems where multiple agents interact, each trying to minimize their expected free energy while accounting for the presence and behavior of other agents. This enables modeling of social behavior, coordination, and collective intelligence.

theoretical_foundation.nested_inference: Agents infer about other agents' beliefs and intentions
theoretical_foundation.theory_of_mind: Recursive belief modeling: I believe you believe I believe...
theoretical_foundation.social_generative_models: Models that include other agents as part of the world

belief_modeling.first_order: Model other agents as having fixed beliefs
belief_modeling.second_order: Model other agents as having beliefs about your beliefs
belief_modeling.higher_order: Recursive modeling of beliefs about beliefs
belief_modeling.bounded_recursion: Practical limits on depth of belief modeling

social_coordination.joint_policies: Policies that account for other agents' actions

examples.name: Communication Game
examples.scenario: Speaker and listener with shared vocabulary
examples.active_inference: Both agents minimize free energy over communication

examples.name: Collective Foraging
examples.scenario: Agents share information about resource locations
examples.active_inference: Balance individual goals with information sharing
examples.outcome: Emergent division of labor and coordination

mathematical_formulation.joint_generative_model: p(o¹, o², s¹, s², θ¹, θ²) includes both agents
mathematical_formulation.nested_beliefs: q(θ²|θ¹) - beliefs about other agent's parameters
mathematical_formulation.social_expected_free_energy: G(π¹, π²) accounts for both agents' preferences
mathematical_formulation.nash_equilibrium: Fixed point where no agent can improve unilaterally

applications.collective_intelligence: Group decision making and problem solving

challenges.infinite_recursion: Practical limits on belief modeling depth

interactive_exercises.description: Model communication between Active Inference agents

common_misconceptions.misconception: Multi-agent Active Inference requires perfect knowledge of others
common_misconceptions.clarification: Works with uncertain beliefs about other agents
Can model competition and conflict as well

further_reading.title: Active Inference and Social Cognition
further_reading.author: Community literature
further_reading.description: Applications to social psychology and behavior
